title: The Biways
text: The British Isles, also known as the Biways, consists of England, Scotland, Ireland, Wales, Greenland, Iceland, and other smaller islands.

title: The Biways
text:
Primary deity
None/agnostic

title: The Biways
text:
Positives

Rich: The Biways is the financial hub of the world. The pound is the most traded and trusted currency in the world.
Nuclear power: Greenland is used for nuclear power generation to sell to the world, especially the USA.
Research: Contains many universities with leading research.

title: The Biways
text:
Negatives

Corrupt: It is a great place for off shore bank accounts and laundering money. It is a haven for fugitives of other countries. As long as the fugitive has capital. Many of the world’s elites and most dangerous live in the Biways, benefiting from interacting with each other.
Dangerous science: Iceland is where many dangerous scientific research is carried out is carried out by super scientists across the world.
Brain drain: The Biways is very attractive to experts across the world. This unfortunately takes away specilaists from other countries that may need them more.

title: The Biways
text: The biways keeps a large standing army, air-force, and naval force on Greenland.

title: CAC
text: Coalition of African Countries. All of Africa.

title: CAC
text:
Primary deity
The primary deity of the CAC is Tartarus.

title: CAC
text:
Positives

Community: Life can be a struggle in the CAC, however this with the culture leads to strong bonds of communities.
Reformers: The power and its citizens believe in second chances. They abhor imprisonment and instead try to reform criminals.
Justice: They will not stand for any form of oppression. They tolerate much except intolerance.

title: CAC
text:
Negatives

Habitat destruction: The natural resources are heavily extracted in the continent.
Capital punishment: The death sentence is commonly used for repeat offenders of severe crimes.
Exploited: As in history the land and people of the CAC are exploited by the other powers of the world.

title: ERA
text: The European & Russian Alliance. Europe & Russia.

title: ERA
text:
Primary deity
The primary deity of the ERA is Proteus.

title: ERA
text:
Positives

Free movement: Has a lingua franca (English). This allows lots of movement across countries therefore sharing skills and knowledge across the alliance.
Coastal: Most of their major cities are on coasts allowing most of their war torn (WWII) inner lands to be claimed by nature. This benefit’s the physical and mental health of the citizens.
World trade: They are the world’s port trade hub.

title: ERA
text:
Negatives

Impressionable: They are easily swayed by the culture of other powers, primarily the USA. This means they place less value on their own cultures.
Low hanging fruit pickers: They like easy fixes and jobs even if it ends up costing them more in the long run.
Scarred: Due to the damage of WWII the power is traumatised. They do not deal well with aggression and tend to allow others to get their way when threatened.

title: ERA military
text: The ERA military.

title: ERA military
text:
CYBORG COLOSSAL SQUID
(10 HP)

Titanium coated beak (1D6+2 DAMAGE), target needs to be grappled by squid
Tentacles with steel tipped hooks (3, DAMAGE) successful attack grapples the target
Aluminium plating (1 ARMOR)
Ink cloud (accessory, 1 use)
Front facing soccer ball eyes with in built headlights (photophores)
Russian designed programming interface

SIMPLE: Although large and powerful they have low intellect. Before they are deployed they must be given a 10 word directive that they will follow. No punctuation can be used and it must be a complete sentence that makes sense.

title: Oceania
text: Oceania: Australia, New Zealand, Tasmania, and other small islands.

title: Oceania
text:
Primary deity
Oceania cannot decide on a single deity and can be described as polytheist.

title: Oceania
text: Positives

title: Oceania
text: Negatives

title: SAE
text: The Supreme Asian Empire. All countries of the Asian continent except Russia with India & China co-leading uneasily.

title: SAE
text:
Primary deity
The primary deity of the SAE is Nyxmera.

title: SAE
text:
Positives

Variety: The different cultures across the empire are allowed to flourish.
Growth: The power is in a period of rapid growth. Many super and mega projects are under way in the empire.
Population & food: They have the largest population in the world. Rather than being a weakness they are able to fully utilise economies of scale with a primarily vegetarian diet to have very good food security.

title: SAE
text:
Negatives

Disputes: Many disagreements in the empire with China and India constantly arguing. This can lead to progress being impeded.
Totalitarian: Law and order is heavily enforced.
Static: Many language with no lingua franca amongst the population. This causes little movement of people across countries.

title: SAE military
text: Military troops from various countries are mixed together into groups and deployed all over the SAE. There are too many oral languages and no consensus was made for a lingua franca of the military. Instead all members of the military learn a specialised gesture based language based on hand and arm signals and a mixture of Asian sign languages. This allows one member of a team who understands the spoken language of the current officer in charge to distribute the commands on the field.

title: SAE military
text:
SAE INFANTRY
(3 HP, 2D6 appear)

Type 63 assault rifle (1D6+1 DAMAGE)
Pistol Auto 9mm 1A (1D6 DAMAGE)
Combat knife (1D6 DAMAGE)
Bulletproof vest (1 ARMOR)
1 Smoke grenade (1 use)
Mixture of Asian ethnicities

NUMEROUS: Although the SAE does not have the newest military tech they make up for it with sheer numbers of infantry. They are eerily silent, primarily communicating in the SAE military sign language. Due to this SAE INFANTRY are great at stealth and it is difficult to catch them unaware.

title: The Moon
text:
Space travel was expedited due to the world governments working together to carry it out. The Japanese refugees took this as an opportunity to create a new home as the first settlers on the moon at the start of the 1960s. They are now known as Mooners.
They have 2 major metropolises there called Usagi (Rabbit) and Kaguya. They specialise in combustion light-gas guns (large cannons with high velocity), hydrogen batteries, and mecha. When they are ready they plan to take back Japan.

title: The Moon
text:
CARGO MECHA
(10 HP)

Stainless steel plating (2 ARMOR)
Self destruct, 10 second timer (2D6 DAMAGE)
Bipedal mecha lacking a head
Frame of steel beams and rods
10-15 feet tall
Torso with cockpit for one pilot

GASHAPON: Able to fit inside a standard 20ft by 8ft shipping container these mecha can be easily hidden and deployed. With rudimentary AI they self assemble and then help the pilot into their cockpit. They are highly customisable, when one is encountered roll 1D6 on each of the “Mecha gear tables” to determine their gear and legs.
FRAIL: When the CARGO MECHA is reduced to 0 HP it can no longer function. Additionally, any excess damage when it reaches 0 HP is taken by the pilot.

title: The Moon
text:
Mecha gear tables
All the below gear is too large to be used by human sized beings.

Ranged weapons

1-2: Mecha hand cannon (1D6+3 DAMAGE) & Mecha shield (1 ARMOR, accessory)
3-4: Duel Ho-8 auto cannon (2D6 DAMAGE)
5-6: Light-gas long range cannon (1D6+3 DAMAGE, ARMOR-PIERCING).

ARMOR-PIERCING weapon tag: Attacks with this weapon ignore ARMOR bonuses granted by physical means. F:UE)




Melee weapons

1-2: 2 Thermite spears, explosive throwing spear (3D6 DAMAGE, 1 use)
3-4: Force knuckledusters (2D6 DAMAGE)
5-6: Energy blade (1D6+3 DAMAGE, VORPAL)

VORPAL: On double sixes you may decapitate one of the heads of the target, if indeed it has a head.




Locomotion

1-2: Bunny legs, able to jump large distances but poor at walking
3-4: Tank treads, inspired but reliable
5-6: Spider legs, slow but able to climb vertical surfaces

title: USA
text: The United States of America. The number one power consisting of all the Americas.

title: USA
text:
Primary deity
The primary deity of the USA is Gaia.

title: USA
text:
Positives

Powerful: It is the most powerful and advanced power in the world. This leads to a comfortable way of life for many citizens.
Education: Top notch education leads to an intelligent population. All citizens learn English, Spanish and French from a young age.
United: The power is united in their ideals and are able to accomplish what they want with minimal issues.

title: USA
text:
Negatives

Superiority complex: The USA and its citizens are confident of their superiority. They look down on other powers and cultures.
Group mind: All citizens are taught in the same way and watch the same media. They are as close to a hive mind without being connected to each other. This has lead to poor creativity and no devil’s advocates.
Hyper capitalist: Believe that citizens are for the benefit of the economy.

title: USA military
text:
(4 HP)

Spear mouth guard (1D6 DAMAGE)
Laser (1D6+1 DAMAGE) works in air and water
Cyborg armor (1 ARMOR)
Retractile quad legs, sharp pointed ends for safe ice travel vertically & horizontally
Saddle for 1 passenger
Translator & comms module (TCM)
Echolocation

SOCIAL: CYBORG DOLPHINS are prized due to their communication skills. Humans can orally speak with them if they connect to their TCM. However, Dolphins can only use and understand single syllable words. They will listen to their rider if they are respected and treated well.



(20 HP)

4 torpedoes (1D6+2 DAMAGE)
Sparse titanium plates (1 ARMOR)
Control dock mounted in front of the blowhole, connected to the brain of the whale. Human captain controls it like a vehicle (2HP, 4 ARMOR)
Large hump crate on back
Deployable millipede like legs to get onto ground

AMPHIBIOUS: The true purpose of the submersible is to emerge from the waters and become a ground borne weapons platform. Once out of the water and with some time it deploys its gear from its hump crate. It retains its HP but becomes a HUMPBACK WHALE WEAPONS PLATFORM.



(20 HP)

Forward mounted cannons controlled by pilot (3D6+3 DAMAGE, ANTI-MATERIAL, 2 uses)
Fully deployed titanium plating (3 ARMOR), supports whale’s weight
Control dock mounted in front of the blowhole, connected to the brain of the whale. Human captain controls it like a vehicle (2HP, 4 ARMOR)
Deck on back with 1 ARMOR walls
Metal ladders on both sides towards the tail
One Left and one right side mounted Ball turret (6HP, 2 ARMOR) each with 2 M2 Browing heavy machine guns XM214 Microgun (1D6+2 DAMAGE), need to be manned

PAKICETUS: Whales are back on land and they are packing. These armoured cetaceans get troops where they need to be by carving a path of destruction.
ANTI-MATERIEL weapon tag: Deals double DAMAGE to vehicles and structures; cumbersome to carry around. (F:UE)

title: USA military
text:

title: History
text:
WWII ends with the nuclear bombing of Japan, unleashing kaiju from the DOT. The population of Japan is evacuated. Thankfully the Kaiju are kept land bound on the main Japan island by the powers of Gaia & Proteus.
Due to this Nuclear weapons are banned by world governments leading to uneasy peace. This lead to the formation of major superpowers.

The Biways: England, Scotland, Ireland, Wales, Greenland, Iceland, and other smaller islands.
USA: United States of America. The number one superpower consisting of all the Americas
ERA: European & Russian Alliance. Europe & Russia.
CAC: Coalition of African Countries. All of Africa.
SAE: Supreme Asian Empire. All Asian countries except Russia with India & China co-leading uneasily.
Oceania: Australia, New Zealand, Tasmania, and other small islands.
The Moon: Settled primarily by Japanese refugees.

title: Overview
text:
Hello, I’m M Gemmell. This website acts as a landing page for my various interests.
This includes:

title: Overview
text:
Contact
If you would like to contact me you can donate and private message me on my Ko-fi with your contact details (you can donate a min of £1):

title: Academia
text:

Many of my papers come from having been a contributor of the COVID-19 Genomics UK Consortium at The University of Liverpool (source).

title: Academia
text:
MG Bookdown guide



 A quick and dirty guide on how I use bookdown. It is primarily for my use but if someone else finds it I hope it will also proof useful. Additionally, this was made with R Bookdown.
Link: https://m-gemmell.github.io/Bookdown_guide/01-MG_Bookdown_guide.html
